page.title: 05COPLEY HILL FACTORY FARMING
page.content: In 1965 as well as arable farming COPLEY HILL also introduced battery farming for egg production. This runs at a loss, due to competition in Europe and E.E.C. regulations,and the batteries are soon to close down. The farm has 18,000 hens, although in 1975 it had 110,000. At present, 12,000 eggs are produced daily. Eggs are sent to a packing station at Soham near Ely, to be graded from 1 to 6 according to size. The average price received for the eggs in 1985 is 42p a dozen. 2 breeds of chicken are used, Warren and Ross Brown. Chickens are kept for 1 year egg laying and are then sold for meat. Each battery contains up to 6,000 hens, kept at the same temperature throughout the year. Despite mechanisation, the eggs are still collected by hand.
